algorithms.trees

Class TDP_Recursive

  • java.lang.Object
    • algorithms.trees.TDP_Anyk_Iterator
      • algorithms.trees.TDP_Recursive

  • public class TDP_Recursive
extends TDP_Anyk_Iterator
    Implementation of Anyk-Rec for T-DP, a ranked enumeration algorithm that relies on recursion: a node finds the next best solution by recursively finding the next best solutions of its children.
    Brief description of the algorithm: Each node maintains a priority queue TDP_DecisionSet.pq_rec for each branch of the tree with the current candidates for the next best subtree solution. The method get_next() works by popping from that PQ and replacing that candidate with a subtree solution that goes to the same child but then takes the next best subtree from the child (determined recursively with find_next_recursive(entities.trees.TDP_Subtree_Solution)). We also need to combine to appropriately combine and rank the subtree solutions from each branch. To do that, we use a Lawler procedure at each PQ that performs ranked enumeration in the space of subtree solutions of the children. The ranked order of the subtree solutions from a particular node is also stored with TDP_Subtree_Solution.next pointers and reused among different find_next_recursive(entities.trees.TDP_Subtree_Solution) calls. This provides a speedup as the computation keeps going.
    Since multiple nodes could share the same decisions, we maintain the PQs at TDP_DecisionSet objects instead of TDP_State_Node.
    Author:
    Nikolaos Tziavelis
    See Also:
    Ranked Enumeration Algorithm

        private TDP_Subtree_Solution latest_solution

    • Constructor Detail

      • TDP_Recursive

        public TDP_Recursive(TDP_Problem_Instance inst)

    • Method Detail

      • initialize_pq

        private void initialize_pq(TDP_DecisionSet curr_decisionSet)
        Initializes the data strucures that the algorithm needs. We initialize a PQ that has each decision concatenated with the best subtrees from the children. Not needed for the decisions that lead to leaf node - no PQ is needed there.
        Parameters:
        curr_decisionSet - The current set of decisions to be initialized.

      • get_best_subtree_solutions

        private TDP_Subtree_Collection get_best_subtree_solutions(TDP_State_Node curr_node)
        Computes a collection of the best subtree solutions starting from a node, one for each of its branches. Because of the prefix structure of the collections, we initialize them only with the best solution for the first branch (index 0).
        Parameters:
        curr_node - The starting node.
        Returns:
        TDP_Subtree_Collection The best subtree solutions.

      • get_best_subtree_solution

        private TDP_Subtree_Solution get_best_subtree_solution(TDP_State_Node curr_node,
                                                       int branch)
        Computes the best subtree solution starting from a node for one particular branch. Because many nodes may share the same decisions (and thus subtree solutions), we do that for every TDP_DecisionSet. We also store the result so that subsequent calls return immediately.
        Parameters:
        curr_node - The starting node.
        branch - One of its branches.
        Returns:
        TDP_Subtree_Collection The best subtree solution in that branch.

      • get_next

        public TDP_Solution get_next()
        Description copied from class: TDP_Anyk_Iterator
        Computes the next T-DP solution of TDP_Anyk_Iterator.instance in ranked order (ascending cost). Ties are broken arbitrarily.
        Specified by:
        get_next in class TDP_Anyk_Iterator
        Returns:
        TDP_Solution The next best T-DP solution or null if there are no other solutions.

      • find_next_recursive

        private TDP_Subtree_Solution find_next_recursive(TDP_Subtree_Solution curr)
        Determines the next best subtree solution that starts from a node recursively.
        Parameters:
        curr - The subtree solution whose next will be computed.
        Returns:
        TDP_Subtree_Solution

      • expand

        private void expand(TDP_Subtree_Solution sol)
        Expands optimally a subtree solution from a particular node that contains only some of the branches (by adding to them the best subtrees for the branches that are missing).
        Parameters:
        sol - The subtree solution to expand.
